title: Save $250 or more on the newest MacBook Air with this spectacular Prime Day sale
content:
Macworld

The MacBook Air is one of the most popular laptops around because it’s a great combination of features, portability, and price. Speaking of price, you can save some money on a brand-new MacBook Air, thanks to Amazon’s October Prime Day. Amazon is offering up to $265 off on several models of the MacBook Air:

  • M2 13-inch MacBook Air, 256GB: $749 ($250 off, MSRP $999)
  • M3 13-inch MacBook Air, 256GB: $849 ($250 off, MSRP $1,099)
  • M3 13-inch MacBook Air, 512GB: $1,049 ($250 off, MSRP $1,299)
  • M3 15-inch MacBook Air, 256GB: $1,044 ($255 off, MSRP $1,299)
  • M3 15-inch MacBook Air, 512GB: $1,234 ($265 off, MSRP $1,499)

The M2 and M3 MacBook Air have the same thin and light design with a gorgeous Liquid Retina display and super-skinny bezels, along with 18-hour battery life, a fantastic keyboard, fast charging with MagSafe, and two Thunderbolt ports. The main difference between the two models is the chip, though there are some other upgrades with the M3 model, such as the ability to run two external displays at the same time.

If you aren’t sure which MacBook to buy read out MacBook Buying Guides: Best MacBook and our MacBook Air vs MacBook Pro comparison. For more MacBook Air deals see Best MacBook Air deals and for more MacBook Pro deals see Best MacBook Pro deals.

Amazon Prime Day: Best MacBook accessory deals

Prime Day is also a great opportunity to save some cash on some accessories for your MacBook. Perhaps you need a spare charger for your MacBook. Or perhaps you want a dock, a printer, or a bag. If we spot a good deal we’ll list it here.

We also have separate roundups for the Best Prime Day Mac monitor and display deals and Best Prime Day storage deals for Mac. Plus find a cut-price Apple keyboard, mouse or Trackpad: Best Prime Day Apple accessories deals.

U.S. Mac accessory Prime Day deals

  • Magic Keyboard with Touch ID & Numeric keypad: $112 ($17 off, MSRP $129)
  • Magic TrackPad: $110 ($19 off, MSRP $129
  • Magic Mouse (black): $91 ($8 off, MSRP $99)

Prime Day: How can I get the best MacBook deals?

Once Prime Day begins, most deals will be exclusive for Prime members, so you’ll need to sign in with an active membership to purchase one of the deals. Prime memberships cost $139 / £95 annually, or $14.99 / £8.99 / AU$6.99 every month. New users can sign up for a 30-day free trial that can be canceled at any time during the trial window. As well as access to sales prices, Prime members also get free two-day shipping and access to Prime Video and all the content available on that service.
